title: How to Reinstall OS X Lion

steps.title: Hold down the “Command” and “R” keys while your Mac is booting.
steps.content: Hold down the “Command” and “R” keys while your Mac is booting. This will allow you to select one of multiple booting options.

steps.title: Select “Recovery HD” when prompted and click the arrow below it to boot into recovery mode.
steps.content: Select “Recovery HD” when prompted and click the arrow below it to boot into recovery mode. It may take a few minutes to boot into recovery mode.

steps.title: Select “Reinstall Mac OS X “ from the Mac OS X Utilities dialog followed by the “Continue” button.
steps.content: Select “Reinstall Mac OS X “ from the Mac OS X Utilities dialog followed by the “Continue” button.

steps.title: Select the drive or volume you want to reinstall Lion on and follow the onscreen instructions to complete the installation.
steps.content: Select the drive or volume you want to reinstall Lion on and follow the onscreen instructions to complete the installation. Note: This option requires an internet connection in order to download the OS from the Apple servers.
